title: Spaceman1000$
author: Spaceman1000$
content: We've heard from the news, the plans federal government has towards the poor, Â they say is to cushion the effect of fuel subsidy, which is giving the poor 8k per month for the next six months to 12 million people.Now here is the interesting part of the whole thing.1, how do you identify the poor in Nigeria, because half of the Nigerian population are not working, so they can be seen to be poor too, so what measures will the FG deploy for the selection of the poor?Because in the Buhari's administration, we had a social intervention program introduced too, and the FG said, they selected the poorest of the poor for the program, and billions of naira was doled out for that program and lots of people never saw a dime from it.2, to what extent will 8 thousand naira go in cushioning the effect?To what extent will 8 thousand go in cushioning the effect of the fuel subsidy, because the prices of goods and services has gone astronomically high, ranging from electricity bill, transportation, food items etc...3. the last administration had this idea.The previous administration had a conditional cash transfer, that we couldn't find a single person that benefited from that program, now to what extent did the program go, they said they gave physical cash to millions of people.I think the FG should come up with real robust plan to Â really cushion the effect of the fuel subsidy, Â like providing busses ðŸšŒðŸšŒðŸšŒ Â at strategic locations within the country, that people can pay a subsidised transport fee, Â constant electricity at an affordable rate across the country and fighting food inflation etchttps://www.channelstv.com/2023/07/13/fg-to-transfer-n8000-to-12-million-poor-households-for-six-months/

comments.author: Forever101
comments.body: This is thoughtful of you, do they think they can play with our intelligence?. If anything will be done, I can suggest FG to beat the money up to 30k , then requirement to be a beneficiary should be by having a bank account. The names, account number /bvn of people working with government, companies or business who earn above 100k should be collected and set aside, then every account not associated with the working class or earn less than 100k should be paid 30k on monthly basis.To do this, it requires skilled and professional technologist/programmers to put this in order to avoid embezzlement. This mechanism will be automated such that everyone recieves their pay directly, no need to entrust Any special body with the disbursement of the fund.Â  I believe it is possible since the bvn carries the people's information. Bank account that must be used mustÂ  be trusted banks in Nigeria. Everyone who didn't recieve it's pay should forward complain to a body who is entrusted to monitor the flow of money into all acoount.

Na tru say dem chop money inside well well but dey share too. People benefit from my house but people wey come to give them money commot 2k inside the 10k wey dem suppose give them. E go dey hard for corruption to end for this our country. Trader money also dey and many people benefit from it including myself thou na just 10k. No be say I dey hail the government but make we talk tru some times and desist from online propaganda abeg.Quote from: Forever101 on July 14, 2023, 10:02:53 AMThe names, account number /bvn of people working with government, companies or business who earn above 100k should be collected and set aside, then every account not associated with the working class or earn less than 100k should be paid 30k on monthly basis.Wait ooo how many people dey earn more than 100k monthly for this country? You for just talk say make dem pay 2/3 of the entire population na. The salary of director wey be the highest paid officer for civil service is slightly above 500k and the rest range from level 10 down ward earn less than 100k so everyone is qualified for the palliative be that if we are to go by that formula.Make dem bring back humanitarian Sadiya to share this 8k palliative, she knows the poor Nigerians. We go use am buy Bobo drink Lol

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: The federal government plans to use 500,000,000 billion naira to give people 8,000 naira as a one time payment, I think this is a very unthoughtful move and it shows the government has a shallow mindset for Nigeria and Nigerians.Currently in the country 8000 naira is practically useless due to the bad economy and harsh recession the country finds itself in, I think rather we use the money to see how to make use of out natural resources and try as much as possible to be a producing country rather than a consuming country.

comments.author: Asiska02
comments.body: Quote from: BIT-BENDER on July 14, 2023, 07:43:49 PMThe federal government plans to use 500,000,000 billion naira to give people 8,000 naira as a one time payment, I think this is a very unthoughtful move and it shows the government has a shallow mindset for Nigeria and Nigerians.It is a one time payment but I think the government wants to provide palliatives to every part of the nation to ease the pain of this fuel subsidy removal which made the price of PMS to be higher which is also affecting the citizens in their daily activities. QuoteCurrently in the country 8000 naira is practically useless due to the bad economy and harsh recession the country finds itself in, I think rather we use the money to see how to make use of out natural resources and try as much as possible to be a producing country rather than a consuming country.We hope and pray that the government looks in to that possibility and explore our natural resources. N8000 might be very small to you but in some parts of Nigeria and their way of living, N8000 will go a long way to solve the affairs of their daily needs for some period of time. This cannot lead the poor out of poverty but will definitely lead to decrease in pain and suffering being encountered by many of them now.

comments.author: sokani
comments.body: Ah no expect much from PDAT and I no dey surprised by dis decision to give 8k to poor Nigerian families in de next 6 months to cushion the effect of Fuel subsidy removal, maybe na because I no like de way de administration take enta office. I no support this move at all because na waste of de people money. Wetin de 8k wan do for de life of an ordinary Nigerian talk atleast of giving 8k to each Nigerian family. We no dey hungry abeg make dem use de money do beta tin. Dis one na anoda wey to loot money be dat because las las dem go just give us Â update leta say after de removal of fuel subsidy, de PDAT led administration was able to assist Nigerians financially in dis difficult time by giving each families 8k.

comments.author: Noson
comments.body: As it is currently in Nigeria, 8,000 cannot comfortably cater for the monthly grocery supply of a family regardless of the size of the family. Let's not even add even aff transportation and other necessities.Well, I'm not sure how they arrived at this said amount to be disbursed to the entire populace, but I feel there should have been better ways to cushion the effect of subsidy removal and not just by disbursing a mere 8,000 that's not going to yield anything meaningful than a meagre square meal.The sad reality of this disbursement is, not everyone will have access to the funds eventually. Because someone might just end up diverting a chunk of the fund for his/her selfish interest. Such a sad reality.In my opinion, the PBAT economic team should come up with creative ideas than disbursement of 8,000. And whoever is in charge should be keenly observed to avoid misappropriation of funds.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: 8k? Sometimes, I try not to be think negative about the country and her leaders. I try my best to have something positive to say about Nigeria. I try and try but the more I try the more it seems I can't find any faith left in the leadership of the country. The distance between the rich and the poor is a wide that it is just absolutely impossible to connect the both of them. How do these people think that 8k for a month will cushion the effects of the the subsidy removal? How does this even make any atom of sense. Some very poor people spend 8k in 5 days on transportation fare from their house to their work place alone. We haven't talked about food and other daily needs. Our government has failed us.
